publicwhip.spmotion: *S2M-3158 Mr Brian Monteith: Quincentenary of Christ’s College, Cambridge—That the Parliament congratulates Christ’s College, University of Cambridge, the college of John Milton and Charles Darwin, on the quincentenary of its foundation; notes the close links that have existed for many years between the college and Scotland; celebrates the contributions made to the college by eminent Scots as exemplified by Lord Todd of Trumpington, who was simultaneously Master of Christ’s and Founding Chancellor of the University of Strathclyde; celebrates the contributions made to scholarship, teaching and research in Scotland by members of Christ’s, and calls on the Scottish Executive to ensure that all young people in Scotland are afforded the opportunity to study at the institution most suited to their skills and talents, regardless of where in the United Kingdom it might be.
